section.name: Hippo Repository JCR/WebDAV Support
section.p: This module supports JCR/WebDAV connections for Hippo Repository. So, you can use JCR APIs against remote Hippo Repository via JCR over WebDAV connections by using this module.

p.em: WARNING: This module support pure JCR API only. It DOES NOT SUPPORT Hippo specific virtual node related APIs and workflow APIs.

subsection.name: Demo Application with Hippo CMS 10
subsection.p: You can check out, build and run demo application, which contains all the examples explained in this site documentation.
Here are example commands to check out, build and run demo application:

div.source: $ svn checkout https://forge.onehippo.org/svn/hipporepojcrdav/hipporepojcrdav-demo/trunk hipporepojcrdav-demo-TRUNK $ cd hipporepojcrdav-demo-TRUNK $ mvn clean verify $ mvn -P cargo.run

subsection.p: Visit http://localhost:8080/site/ and try 'JCR/WebDAV Example 1', 'JCR/WebDAV Example 2' and 'JCR/WebDAV Example 3'. Each source file of those can be found in '/site/examples/about1.jsp', '/site/examples/about2.jsp', and '/site/examples/about3.jsp'.

subsection.name: Demo Application with Hippo CMS 7.8 or 7.9
subsection.p: You can check out, build and run demo application, which contains all the examples explained in this site documentation.
Here are example commands to check out, build and run demo application:

div.source: $ svn checkout https://forge.onehippo.org/svn/hipporepojcrdav/hipporepojcrdav-demo/branches/hipporepojcrdav-demo-0.01.xx $ cd hipporepojcrdav-demo-0.01.xx $ mvn clean verify $ mvn -P cargo.run

subsection.p: Also, visit JCR/WebDAV Example 1, JCR/WebDAV Example 2, and JCR/WebDAV Example 3, (and each example source in JSP) for how to access JCR/WebDAV repository.
